result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam M Swartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 10/31/2017 AMENDED: COURT EXTENDS PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF 1 YEAR.

miscConds.notes:
Per C-31.
10/31/2017 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS MINIMUM $50.00 PAYMENTS PER MONTH TOWARDS RESTITUTION.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit a DNA sample.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam M Swartz in court.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Borgen in court.
Court relates.  Probation Agent Borgen relates.  Defendant relates.  Court instructs probation to be extended for 1 year and orders must pay a minimum of $50.00 per month toward restitution.  Agent will prepare order.
Review hearing on October 31, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam M Swartz in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Adam M Swartz in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM273 and 15CF283 called.  State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

15CM273 - DRI

15CF283
State moves to amend to 961.41(3g)(g) a Class I Felony - Court grants amendment.  Guilty plea entered.  State and defense agree to waive PSI - Court approves.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney Hinde relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 2 years Probation
Restitution $899.00 for 15CM273
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
Court costs including $180.00 buy money
Jail credit of 180 days if revoked
Must submit DNA sample

Defendant Adam M Swartz in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Adam M Swartz in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF283 and 15CM273 called.  Defense requests bond modification to $300 cash with condition he live with his grandmother - State objects - Court denies the motion.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
